intro: Licaria guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan licaria, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
